info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 4:49PM EST until January 09 at 9:15PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR CHARLOTTE AND HALIFAX COUNTIES... At 449 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since late morning. Another band of heavy rain is currently passing across the warned area, with up to an additional inch of rainfall possible. This is likely to produce flash flooding of creeks and streams. Flooding of roads is likely as a result. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... South Boston... Halifax... Brookneal... Keysville... Charlotte Court House... Phenix... Virgilina... This includes the following streams and drainages... Ash Camp Creek, Armistead Branch, Ballous Creek, Bales Spring Branch, Banister River, Aarons Creek, Allen Creek and Austin Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
